text: hello Internet I'm Brandon with this
week's nerd word I was so stoked for
this week's episode as many of you know
it was science week on King Of The Nerds
first off can you believe that Bill Nye
was a judge this guy has been my hero
since I was like five years old the
titans of Riel had to do a lot to kind
of bring themselves back into the game
and I think they did just that this
episode Not only was their project
showing off an impressive chemical
display but also tackled an issue that
real life geologists are working on
right now Midas Touch attack had a very
impressive project as well they decided
to go for more of a fantasy based
approach having Jack NY the Alchemy guy
explain the chemistry behind their
reaction unfortunately Jack was unable
to drop it correctly and it missed its
Target resulting in a thousand more
years of Lord Sauron amassing Uruk Kai I
guess One does not simply rock into
Mordor the whole process of losing the
nerd War seems to have taken its toll on
Zach he reacted almost as volatile as
the chemicals that he was working with
he really needs to learn how to work
better with his team rather than
attacking them and lashing out
irrationally at every single moment
unfortunately this episode has us saying
goodbye to
Josh
I'll hear this Ballad of Josh J wit the
man who caught them all Desiring the
throne he tried his best with his honor
and
pokeballs nerd of the people Josh J witz
lacked skill in this surgical Hall his

his
fall goodbye Josh this week's question
comes from Steve Van smack he
asks how will the winner be determined
popular vote by jury makes no sense for
nerds why Mr van smack you're completely
right that's why Curtis and Bobby have
released an open letter on the TBS
website it states that the winner of
this competition will be chosen by
contest rather than by peer review seems
as though all of you users out there in
the internet have gotten your voices
heard now I gotta run back to lab and
get some work done but I'll see you all
next week Stay classy
